docs.snippet: The United States and China may pursue negotiations to resolve deepening differences over trade, a U.S. trade official said on Wednesday, but he declined to say whether any new high-level meetings were planned.

headline.print_headline: U.S., China May Pursue Talks Over Trade Differences: USTR Official
headline.main: U.S., China May Pursue Talks Over Trade Differences: USTR Official

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court is rejecting an appeal from American victims of terrorist attacks in the Middle East more than a decade ago.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal From Middle East Attack Victims
headline.main: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal From Middle East Attack Victims

docs.snippet: California farmers, many of whom voted for President Donald Trump and his tough talk on trade, say China's increased tariffs on products like almonds, pistachios and wine are a competitive blow, but some are hopeful they will lead to a better deal...

headline.print_headline: California Wine and Nut Growers Call China Tariffs a Blow
headline.main: California Wine and Nut Growers Call China Tariffs a Blow

docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis acknowledged Tuesday that he and President Donald Trump's incoming national security adviser, John Bolton, have different world views but predicted they will develop a working partnership.

headline.print_headline: Mattis Predicts Partnership With Bolton Despite Differences
headline.main: Mattis Predicts Partnership With Bolton Despite Differences

docs.snippet: A full-scale global trade war has not broken out yet - but that hasn't stopped the market from fretting about one or analysts from warning about the potential cost.

headline.print_headline: Trade Conflict Fears to Keep Markets on Edge for Weeks
headline.main: Trade Conflict Fears to Keep Markets on Edge for Weeks

docs.snippet: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, his ratings battered by a scandal over suspected cronyism, is hoping a series of summits including one with U.S. President Donald Trump will restore his popularity ahead of a crucial ruling party leadership cont...

headline.print_headline: Turning to Diplomacy, Japan's Abe Hopes to Change Channel From Scandal Woes
headline.main: Turning to Diplomacy, Japan's Abe Hopes to Change Channel From Scandal Woes

docs.snippet: An enigmatic North Korean leader takes a secretive train trip to China to affirm fraternal ties and declare a commitment to denuclearization.

headline.print_headline: Kim Family Has Made Denuclearization Vows in China Before
headline.main: Kim Family Has Made Denuclearization Vows in China Before

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is expected to announce that it will roll back automobile gas mileage and pollution standards.

headline.print_headline: EPA to Loosen Rules for Automobile Gas Mileage, Pollution
headline.main: EPA to Loosen Rules for Automobile Gas Mileage, Pollution

docs.snippet: The United States plans to sanction Russian oligarchs this week under a law targeting Moscow for meddling in the 2016 U.S. election, sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, in what could be the most aggressive move so far against Russi...

headline.print_headline: U.S. Plans to Sanction Russian Oligarchs This Week: Sources
headline.main: U.S. Plans to Sanction Russian Oligarchs This Week: Sources

docs.snippet: In an episode hosted by Bill Hader, “Saturday Night Live” addressed what has felt like round-the-clock firings and turmoil in the Trump administration.

headline.print_headline: ‘S.N.L.’ Takes Aim at Betsy DeVos, Jeff Sessions and Rex Tillerson
headline.main: ‘S.N.L.’ Takes Aim at Betsy DeVos, Jeff Sessions and Rex Tillerson
